name: Geolocation
description: Secure context This feature is available only in secure contexts (HTTPS), in some or all supporting browsers. The Geolocation interface represents an object able to programmatically obtain the position of the device. It gives Web content access to the location of the device. This allows a Web site or app to offer customized results based on the user's location.

members.name: Geolocation.getCurrentPosition()
members.description: Determines the device's current location and gives back a Position object with the data.

parameters.name: success
parameters.description: A callback function that takes a Position object as its sole input parameter.

parameters.name: error Optional
parameters.description: An optional callback function that takes a PositionError object as its sole input parameter.

members.name: Geolocation.watchPosition()
members.description: Returns a long value representing the newly established callback function to be invoked whenever the device location changes.

parameters.name: success
parameters.description: A callback function that takes a Position object as an input parameter.

parameters.name: error Optional
parameters.description: An optional callback function that takes a PositionError object as an input parameter.

members.name: Geolocation.clearWatch()
members.description: Removes the particular handler previously installed using watchPosition().

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID number returned by the Geolocation.watchPosition() method when installing the handler you wish to remove.
